alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 10:08PM PST until January 07 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with local sets to 11 feet and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Beaches, especially southwest and west facing shores. * WHEN...Until 6 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A rare, strong west swell has created abonrmally strong, very dangerous rip currents.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
